title: Social Intelligence Manager
content:
Job Overview



You will be a lead for the collection, consolidation and strategic use of consumer data for the planning of branded social media content and engagement across the end-to-end consumer journey. You will be working for a leading global beverage account in Japan, consisting of a portfolio of some of the world’s most iconic drinks brands.






Key Accountabilities

Oversee the Insight & Data analytics work and deliver reports, together with explanation presentations. This means crafting data and insight generation that address client’s business challenges and needs, and leading other team members of various expertise to deliver that client need whether data is the final output or not.
Work closely with Social Strategist and Data Analysts to build data and insight collection and utility solutions that will help the client find new optimization opportunities with a focus on social media.
Provide support to answer business questions around competitive intelligence, customer insight (especially how to find innovative ways to get consumer insight) and segmentation, business growth opportunities, and marketing effectiveness.
Help Social Media data interconnect with the wider business data workstreams – CRM, Paid Media, Customer Experience

Core Duties

Strategic planning and implementation of data collection methodology and tools to support optimized social media content – linking to Commerce, CRM, and Customer Experience.
Enable customer, market, channel, product, and brand understanding and deliver actionable insight to internal teams (account teams, planners, analysts, technologists, PMs, and creatives) and/or client teams.
Identify opportunities (markets, consumer segment, products) leveraging data to help client’s business growth.
Design & manage integrated analytics strategy/approach to create measurement frameworks, scorecards and reports that synthesize data (attitudinal and behavioral) to accurately deliver on client’s business objectives.
Translate marketing and business objectives/challenges into data strategy, approaches, analysis, and workflows.




Qualifications




Strong working experience with enterprise-level social media management and listening tools such as Sprinklr, Netbase, BrandWatch is highly desirable.
Experience with Data Reporting tools
Required years of experience: Minimum 8-10 years
At least 5 years of solid hands-on experience in data analysis, digital analytics, designing reports. Statistic modeling nice to have
CRM/user management/commerce data analytics experience desired. Statistic modeling nice to have
Academic requirements: Bachelor’s degree in computer science, economics, business, mathematics, information systems, or related field preferred

 Who you are

Both business and data savvy
Excellent communication and presentation skill
Strong leadership
Can think strategically
Is analytical with a data driven approach
Good problem solver
You are passionate about data, consumer insight and business intelligence that can be mined from social media data. Also needs to be able to ‘humanize’ data and unlock the value of data for clients and the rest of the agency.

Language Requirement

Japanese: : Native / Business – must be able to fully understand the nuances, sentiment and tonality of social media conversations
English : Business – must be able to deliver insight reports written in English

About Us
VML & Ogilvy Japan GK was established in April 2019 as a partnership between Geometry Global and The Ogilvy Group to enhance our offering to brands in Japan in support of their business ambitions and marketing objectives. We believe in the power of creativity to drive meaningful change that delivers positive business outcomes. Now more than ever the ability for an agency to flex and adapt to clients changing needs is vital in the application of communications, brand experience, commerce and technology. Our blend of global and local expertise and marketing capability is designed to meet the challenges of today while setting our clients up for success from tomorrow and beyond. VML & Ogilvy Japan GK is a WPP company (NASDAQ: WWPGY).
VML & Ogilvy Japan GK embraces and celebrates diversity, inclusivity, and equal opportunity. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We are a worldwide creative agency that represents global clients. The more inclusive we are, the more brilliant work we can create together.



 At Ogilvy, our people are at the heart of what we do: a creative agency that sparks game-changing ideas across culture and business through collaboration, integrity, and a celebration of self-expression. 
We believe in building powerful teams with purpose. This means hiring and nurturing talent across all races, ethnicities, religions, abilities, sexual orientation, and gender identities – and we relentlessly curate transformative initiatives that make our commitment to fairness, and equity a reality. 
Our ultimate mission is to leave a positive impact on the world, creating a better future for all, while supporting and uplifting the global communities we serve.  This is central to our mantra of Borderless Creativity.
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.
